text:
Wow, I'm current!  Listened to the whole list!  I just wanted to say thanks, SupraDarky.  This list has been a delightful mix of reliving fond memories and discovering hidden gems.

If only there were a way to put the whole list on shuffle :)

text: I know that, I was making a very bad joke. But I do think the name Pullblox should be mentioned in the title/description as well, Europe isn't any bit less important than USA...
author: NeatNit

text: I'm not sure if you know this already, but Pullblox and Pushmo are the same game.  For some reason it has a different name in different regions.
author: IlurianScribe

text: More to the point, I thoroughly enjoyed the puzzles in Pullbox, some were really easy and some were undeniably difficult. However I was quite annoyed with the overly-childish presentation of it all. Not enough to put me off, but I definitely enjoyed the game a lot less because of it. I have a feeling even children don't like that sort of thing!
author: NeatNit

text: I have not heard of Pushmo. By the way, you should check out Pullblox!

author: Phelpe

text: Super good/addictive puzzler for the 3DS, it's easily one of the best games on the eShop. I haven't tried its sequel Crashmo yet, but I heard it's also awesome. This theme has great variety and I love the usage of both chiptune and real instruments.
author: SupraDarky
